intro: Strepsiphyla villosa, commonly known as the hairy strepsiphyla, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its natural habitat. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Strepsiphyla villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
